program atcoder_ABC043_B
   implicit none
   character(:), allocatable :: s
   character(:), allocatable :: current_str
   integer :: res_len, i, L
   read(*,'(A)',iostat=*) s  ! Adjust this line properly. L = len_trim(s) if(L ==0) then
       print*,''
       stop
   end if

   allocate( character(L) :: current_str )
   res_len =0
   do i=1, L
      select case( s(i:i) )
      case('0','1')
          res_len = res_len +1
          current_str(res_len:res_len) = s(i:i)
      case('B') if( res_len > 0 ) then
              res_len = res_len -1
          end if
      case default  !

          ! Do nothing
      end select
   end do

   if( res_len ==0 ) then
       print*,''
   else
       print '(A)', current_str(1:res_len)
   end if

end program

program atcoder_ABC043_B
    implicit none
    character(len=:), allocatable :: s
    character(len=:), allocatable :: current_str
    integer :: res_len, i, L

    read(*, '(A)') s  ! Read the entire line into s
    L = len_trim(s)
    res_len = 0

    allocate( character(L) :: current_str ) do i = 1, L
        select case (s(i:i))
            case ('0', '1') res_len = res_len + 1
                current_str(res_len:res_len) = s(i:i)
            case ('B') if (res_len > 0) then
                    res_len = res_len - 1
                end if
        end select
    end do

    ! Print the result
    if (res_len == 0) then
        print '(A1)'

program atcoder_ABC043_B
    implicit none
    character(len=:), allocatable :: s
    character(len=:), allocatable :: current_str
    integer :: res_len, i, L

    read(*, '(A)') s
    L = len_trim(s)
    res_len = 0

    allocate( character(L) :: current_str ) do i = 1, L
        select case (s(i:i))
            case ('0', '1') res_len = res_len + 1
                current_str(res_len:res_len) = s(i:i)
            case ('B') if (res_len > 0) then
                    res_len = res_len - 1
                end if
        end select
    end do

    print '(A)', current_str(1:res_len)

    deallocate(current_str)
end program atcoder_ABC043_B

That's better.

The input is read via in.string() which in LightScanner's code:

program atcoder_ABC043_B
    implicit none
    character(len=:), allocatable :: s
    character(len=:), allocatable :: current_str
